question_text: Which of the following can prevent a successful drive replacement in a laptop? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Installing an M.2 NVMe drive into a SATA-only slot
Failing to screw in the M.2 module after insertion
Reusing the same access panel screws
Attempting to install a 2.5 inch drive without a bracket
Using a magnetic screwdriver near the system board
correct_answer: Installing an M.2 NVMe drive into a SATA-only slot
Failing to screw in the M.2 module after insertion
Attempting to install a 2.5 inch drive without a bracket
explanation: Protocol mismatch, lack of physical support (bracket), and an unsecured M.2 drive can cause installation failure. Reusing panel screws and magnetic screwdrivers are usually acceptable when used properly.
